meanings.definition: To feel intense dislike or hostility towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was overhating her new neighbor for playing loud music late at night.
meanings.sent2: He was overhating the cold weather that made his joints ache.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overhating the vacuum cleaner as it moved around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her overhating of spiders reached a point where she couldn't even look at a picture of one.
meanings.sent5: Overhating the taste of broccoli, the child refused to eat it no matter how it was cooked.

meanings.definition: To express strong negative feelings towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The politician was overhating his opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent2: She was overhating the movie for its poor acting and predictable plot.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was overhating the vegetables on his plate by throwing them on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His overhating of the new policy was evident in his scathing remarks during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: Overhating the traffic jam, she honked her horn impatiently while stuck in the line of cars.

meanings.definition: To have an excessive amount of hatred towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The villain in the story was overhating the hero for foiling his plans once again.
meanings.sent2: The student was overhating the difficult math assignment that seemed impossible to solve.
meanings.sent3: The dog was overhating the mailman, barking loudly every time he approached the house.
meanings.sent4: Her overhating of the color red was so extreme that she refused to wear anything even remotely crimson.
meanings.sent5: Overhating the sound of nails on a chalkboard, she cringed every time she heard it.
